text: Ion Eduard Fuhn (1916–1987) was a Romanian herpetologist, interested in ornithology until he came under the influence of Willy Wolterstorff. Fuhn was director of herpetology and arachnology at the Romanian Academy of Science from 1954 to 1976. Two species of skinks are named in his honour, and he was the author of other new taxonomic descriptions. (Kindle edition). == References == Category:Herpetologists Category:1916 births Category:1987 deaths Category:Romanian zoologists Category:20th-century zoologists
title: Ion Eduard Fuhn
